clinical_graph.title: Management of sedation in the ICU — practical pathway

nodes.text: ICU sedation management

Pain-first: assess BPS/CPOT; give analgesia. Optimize oxygenation/ventilation/hemodynamics; correct reversible agitation causes (hypoxia, hypercapnia, hypoglycemia, urinary retention, withdrawal, sepsis).
Plan for extubation today (coordinate SAT with SBT)?
Stop/reduce sedatives for SAT; prepare SBT if criteria met; close monitoring.
No immediate extubation plan; continue goal-directed sedation.
Tolerates SAT without dangerous agitation or respiratory failure?
Proceed with SBT and wean sedation; if successful, extubate and use minimal/no sedatives.
Restart at lower dose; treat triggers; target light sedation.
Deep sedation required (e.g., severe ARDS, refractory ICP, status epilepticus, NMB)?
Deep sedation pathway.
Light sedation pathway.
Contraindication to dexmedetomidine (significant bradycardia/high-grade AV block)?
Use low-dose propofol infusion (add opioid analgesia); avoid oversedation; monitor TGs if prolonged.
Dexmedetomidine infusion for light, arousable sedation; watch for bradycardia/hypotension.
Propofol-based deep sedation with opioid analgesia; daily TG check if high dose/prolonged. Be vigilant for propofol infusion syndrome; monitor CK and lactate.
Hemodynamic instability or marked hypertriglyceridemia?
Prefer midazolam infusion; titrate to goal; minimize duration to reduce delirium/accumulation.
Continue propofol; avoid excessive depth; reassess frequently.
Neuromuscular blockade ongoing?
Ensure deep analgesia and sedation; consider processed EEG if needed; monitor train-of-four.
No NMB; continue standard monitoring.

Set and document target sedation: RASS −1 to −2 for most; deeper only if clearly indicated. Reassess RASS/SAS q2–4 h and after dose changes. Avoid routine benzodiazepines; reserve midazolam for instability or procedures. Document the RASS target in orders.
Daily sedation interruption when safe; coordinate with SBT; restart at lower dose if needed.
Delirium suspected/confirmed (e.g., CAM-ICU positive)?

Nonpharmacologic bundle: reorientation, sleep hygiene, early mobilization, glasses/hearing aids; minimize benzos/anticholinergics; consider short-course antipsychotic only for severe distress/safety (monitor QTc).
No delirium; continue current plan and prevention bundle.
Stable, goal-directed sedation with regular reassessment, SAT/SBT coordination, and delirium prevention.
